title: 10 Provocations for Circular Design - Metropolis Magazine
summary: Many building materials are not currently recycled, reused, or remanufactured because of a lack of infrastructure, clear recycling streams, and cost to remanufacture. Retrofitting and renovation projects can sometimes extend the life of buildings, but they can also generate a lot of waste. Using biobased and biodegradable materials is not a perfect solution because we would need a lot of new composting infrastructure to handle them, and they can still be harmful to the environment if they end up in landfills or oceans. Ultimately, reducing consumption and waste is the best way to create a more sustainable built environment.
green_innovation: TRUE, the article discusses several ways to reduce the environmental impact of buildings and their materials.
business_innovation: TRUE, the article discusses several new products and processes that could be used to make buildings more sustainable.
likely_naics_codes: ['236220 - Commercial and Institutional Building Construction', '562910 - Remediation Services', '327990 - All Other Miscellaneous Fabricated Metal Product Manufacturing', '541330 - Engineering Services']
greenwashing: The article does not mention greenwashing.

title: CEFLEX Teams up with Recyda to Facilitate Sustainable Design Check Tool - Packaging Strategies
summary: CEFLEX has launched a free online tool to help companies assess the recyclability of their flexible packaging designs. The tool is based on the CEFLEX 'Designing for a Circular Economy' (D4ACE) guidelines, which aim to ensure that all flexible packaging is optimized for collection, sorting, and recycling. The tool can be used to assess existing packaging designs or to develop new products that meet the D4ACE guidelines.

title: The Story Behind Coachtopia, Coach’s New Vision for Circular Fashion - Retail TouchPoints
summary: Coachtopia is a new brand launched by Coach to address the environmental impact of the fashion industry. The brand has established clear principles for circularity, which guide the design, crafting, and reuse of its products. Coachtopia is also investing in talent by creating circular design scholarships to support emerging sustainability non-profits led by the Gen Z community.

The brand has established clear principles for circularity, which guide the design, crafting, and reuse of its products. This is a green innovation because it is a new way of thinking about the fashion industry that has the potential to reduce the environmental impact of the industry.
business_innovation: TRUE. Coachtopia is a new brand that is focused on creating a circular fashion industry. This is a business innovation because it is a new way of thinking about the fashion industry that has the potential to make the industry more sustainable and profitable.

green_process: TRUE. Coachtopia has established clear principles for circularity, which guide the design, crafting, and reuse of its products. title: Cisco Unveils Next-Generation Environmental Sustainability Strategy - CXOToday.com
summary: Cisco's environmental sustainability strategy focuses on transitioning to clean energy, evolving the business to circular, and investing in resilient ecosystems. To power the world with renewables, the grid requires updated digital infrastructure to connect diverse, decentralized sources of clean energy. Cisco aims to transform its business to extend the useful life of its products and provide ongoing services.

title: 'Design Check' tool from CEFLEX to enable collaborative flexible packaging design - Packaging Europe
summary: CEFLEX and Recycla have developed a new ‘Design Check’ tool to streamline collaboration between designers, technologists, customers, and suppliers of flexible packaging and drive the creation of sustainability-minded packaging. The tool can be used either to assess an existing package, facilitate the R&D and design process, engage with other parts of the value chain, or prepare for recyclability testing. The tool makes CEFLEX’s ‘Designing for a Circular Economy’ (D4ACE) guidelines easier to use, providing a record to track improvements over time and helping the value chain continue to accelerate progress on circular design.

title: Vivobarefoot Is Serious About Circularity and Scoring Its Environmental Impact - Footwear News
summary: Vivobarefoot, a UK-based footwear brand, has partnered with textile-to-textile recycling company Circ to develop more circular design solutions. Together, they aim to create a fully recyclable shoe made entirely of a single material (polyester) that can be chemically recycled and reused without the need for virgin materials. The new footwear is slated to launch in fall 2024.
green_innovation: TRUE. The innovation is a new design solution for footwear that is fully recyclable and made from recycled materials.
business_innovation: TRUE. The innovation is a new product, the Vivobarefoot Primus Circular, that is made from a single material (polyester) that can be chemically recycled and reused without the need for virgin materials.
green_product: TRUE. The Vivobarefoot Primus Circular is a green product because it is made from recycled materials and is fully recyclable.
green_process: TRUE. The process of chemically recycling polyester to create the Vivobarefoot Primus Circular is a green process because it reduces waste, conserves natural resources, and decreases energy consumption.

title: This New Upholstery Line Features Yarn Made From Marine Plastic - Metropolis Magazine
summary: Mayer Fabrics has made significant progress in sustainability over the past 13 years, including reducing its reliance on virgin polyester, VOCs, and operational carbon. The company's latest upholstery line, the SEAQUAL Initiative collection, features fabrics made with recycled marine polyester and is GreenGuard Gold certified for low VOC emissions. Mayer Fabrics has also eliminated the use of flame retardants and PFAS chemicals in its fabrics.

business_innovation: TRUE. The article describes how Mayer Fabrics has developed a new line of upholstery fabrics that are more sustainable than its previous products. The new fabrics are made with recycled materials, are free of harmful chemicals, and have low VOC emissions.
